intro: Helichrysum pseudoanaxeton, commonly known as the golden marguerite, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellow to golden-orange flowers that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in a compact, bushy form with narrow, gray-green leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
